    • Method Detail

      • getBasicFactory

        public Factory getBasicFactory()
        Description copied from interface: EngineApi
        Get the factory used to create the different parts of the execution environment for this engine. The factory can be requested to return the reader, lexical analyzer and other objects that are used internally to manage the execution of the program. To use the ScriptBasic Engine there is no need for this method This method provides a way to access the objects that are below this facade and is available for advanced programmers who are not satisfied with the features provided with this facade.

        If ever you need to use this method, do use it at your own risk, and inform the developers of your need so that they may consider extending this facade to accommodate your needs.

        Specified by:
        getBasicFactory in interface EngineApi
        Returns:
        the factory instance

        public void load(String sourceName,
        SourceProvider provider)
          throws ScriptBasicException
        Description copied from interface: EngineApi

        Specified by:
        load in interface EngineApi
        Parameters:
        sourceName - the name of the source file where the source is. The syntax of the name depends on the provider.
        provider - the source provider that helps the reader to read the content
        Throws:
        ScriptBasicException

      • getVariable

        public Object getVariable(String name)
                   throws ScriptBasicException
        Description copied from interface: EngineApi
        Get the value of a global variable after the BASIC program was executed.
        Specified by:
        getVariable in interface EngineApi
        Parameters:
        name - of the variable
        Returns:
        the value of the variable converted to Java. Thus there is no need to deal with ScriptBasic internal classes. If the variable contains an integer then this method will return a Long, if it is a string then it will be a String and so on.
        Throws:
        ScriptBasicException

      • getVariablesIterator

        public Iterable<String> getVariablesIterator()
        Description copied from interface: EngineApi
        Get an iterator that iterates through the names of the global variables.
        Specified by:
        getVariablesIterator in interface EngineApi
        Returns:
        the iterator to fetch the names of the global variables one by one.

      • call

        public Object call(String subroutineName,
          Object... args)
            throws ScriptBasicException
        Description copied from interface: EngineApi
        Call the named subroutine with the arguments.

        It is recommended to call subroutines via a Subroutine object.

        Specified by:
        call in interface EngineApi
        Parameters:
        subroutineName - the name of the subroutine to be called.
        args - the arguments to be passed to the subroutine. Note that there has to be that many arguments passed as many arguments are needed by the subroutine. If there are less number of actual arguments the rest of the arguments will be undefined. If you pass more actual arguments than the subroutine expects you will get an exception.
        Returns:
        the value returned by the subroutine. Note that this value is already converted to Java object and not a raw ScriptBasic RightValue but rather a Long, Double, String or similar.
        Throws:
        ScriptBasicException

      • getSubroutineNames

        Description copied from interface: EngineApi
        Get the names of all subroutines.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

        the subroutine object.
        Throws:

      • registerExtension

        public void registerExtension(Class<?> klass)
                       throws ScriptBasicException
        Description copied from interface: EngineApi
        Register the static methods of the class as BASIC functions. After the registration the methods can be called from BASIC just as if they were built-in functions in the language or just like if they were defined as BASIC subroutines.

        The registration process uses only the methods that are annotated as Function and only if their Function.classification() parameter is not configured in the configuration file as forbidden.

        Even though the static methods are called via reflection they have to be callable from the BASIC interpreter. Simply saying they have to be public.

        Specified by:
        registerExtension in interface EngineApi
        Parameters:
        klass - the class to parse.
        Throws:
        ScriptBasicException
